# Naming Conventions

Naming conventions rename your photos using patterns with tokens and custom text.

Instead of generic names like `IMG_1234.jpg`, create organized names like `2025-12-08_John_meeting_001.jpg`.

## Available Tokens

Replace these placeholders with actual values:

| Token | Result | Example |
|-------|--------|---------|
| `{date}` | Photo date (YYYY-MM-DD) | 2025-12-08 |
| `{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}` | Date and time | 20251208_143022 |
| `{original_name}` | Original filename | IMG_1234 |
| `{camera_model}` | Camera from EXIF | Canon_EOS_R5 |
| `{userid}` | Your username | john_doe |
| `{sequence:03d}` | Auto-incrementing number | 001, 002, 003 |
| `{title}` | From metadata template | Meeting |

## Creating Patterns

You can mix tokens with any custom text:

**Format:** `{token}_custom-text_{another-token}`

## Pattern Examples

### Simple Date + Original Name
```
Pattern: {date}_{original_name}
Result: 2025-12-08_IMG_1234.jpg
```

### Date + Custom Text + Sequence
```
Pattern: {date}_ES-meeting_{sequence:03d}
Result: 2025-12-08_ES-meeting_001.jpg
       2025-12-08_ES-meeting_002.jpg
       2025-12-08_ES-meeting_003.jpg
```

### Username + Date + Original Name
```
Pattern: {userid}_{date}_{original_name}
Result: john_doe_2025-12-08_IMG_1234.jpg
```

### Date + Project + Title
```
Pattern: {date}_Project-ABC_{title}
Result: 2025-12-08_Project-ABC_Meeting.jpg
```

### Date + Camera + Travel + Sequence
```
Pattern: {date}_{camera_model}_travel_{sequence:03d}
Result: 2025-12-08_Canon_EOS_R5_travel_001.jpg
```

### Year + Month + Sequence
```
Pattern: 2025-12_{sequence:03d}
Result: 2025-12_001.jpg
```

### Client Name + Date + Sequence
```
Pattern: Client-XYZ_{date}_{sequence:03d}
Result: Client-XYZ_2025-12-08_001.jpg
```

## Creating a Naming Convention

1. Click **Create Naming Convention**
2. Enter a name (e.g., "Travel Photos", "Work Meetings")
3. Enter your pattern
4. Click **Save Convention**

The pattern appears in your naming dropdown for future use.

## Edit or Remove

- Select naming convention in list
- Click **Edit** to change pattern or **Remove** to delete

## Using Naming Conventions

1. Select one or more photos
2. Choose a naming convention from the **Naming** dropdown
3. Click **Preview New Names** to see how they'll be renamed
4. Click **Rename Files** to apply

## Numbering Format

`{sequence:03d}` creates 3-digit numbers:
- 001, 002, 003... (for up to 999 photos)

Use `{sequence:02d}` for 2-digit: 01, 02, 03...

Or just `{sequence}` for auto-numbered: 1, 2, 3...

## Common Mistakes

❌ **Too many tokens**
```
{date}_{time}_{camera}_{location}_{subject}_{userid}_{sequence}
```
Creates very long names. Keep it simple.

✅ **Better - keep it short**
```
{date}_{subject}_{sequence:03d}
```

❌ **Special characters**
```
{date} & {subject} / {sequence}
```
Slashes and ampersands cause problems on some systems.

✅ **Better - use underscores and hyphens**
```
{date}_{subject}_{sequence:03d}
```

## Tips

- Use underscores `_` or hyphens `-` to separate parts
- Keep names under 80 characters
- Avoid special characters: `& / \ : * ? " < > |`
- Test with **Preview New Names** first
- Use **Dry Run** checkbox for preview before applying
